#summary Get jai-tools jars via Maven.

= Introduction =

If you are using [http://maven.apache.org/ Maven] as your build tool you can get the jai-tools jars downloaded automagically. Presently, only the snapshot jars are available (built from the latest code on _trunk_ in the subversion repository). The jai-tools repository contains the jai-tools binaries, sources and javadoc jars.

Add the jai-tools snapshot repository to your projects pom.xml file:
{{{
    <repositories>
        <repository> 
            <id>jaitools-snapshots</id> 
            <name>jaitools snapshots</name> 
            <url>http://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/</url> 
            <snapshots> 
                <enabled>true</enabled> 
            </snapshots> 
        </repository>
    </repositories>
}}}

Add the jai-tools modules that you want to use in your project as dependencies:
{{{
    <dependencies>
        <!-- Example: adding utils module for DiskMemImage etc -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.googlecode.jaitools</groupId>
            <artifactId>utils</artifactId>
            <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
}}}

= Available modules =

== General modules ==

|| *Module* || *Description* ||
|| demo || Demo programs ||
|| jiffle || The jiffle image scripting language ||
|| kernel || Factory and utility classes to work with KernelJAI objects ||
|| utils || Support classes including !DiskMemTileCache and !DiskMemImage ||

== Image operator modules ==

|| *Module* || *Description* ||
|| kernelstats || Calculates neighbourhood statistics ||
|| maskedconvolve || Extends the standard !JAI convolve operator with source and destination masking ||
|| rangelookup || An image lookup operator that can handle both integral and floating point data types and work with value ranges ||
|| regionalize || Identifies regions of (sufficiently) uniform value in a source image ||
|| zonalstats || Calculates statistics for values in a source image, optionally grouped by zones in a control image ||
